Hi, I’m Yanqing Wang, a first-year master’s student in Carnegie Mellon University (CMU), majoring in Computer Science.

I am concentrated on web application development, and most familiar with Django, Vue.js and React.js. The projects I am most proud of are:

  • Node.js-powered Signal Visualization Platform
  • Django-based Graduate School Application Community

I am now actively seeking 2019 summer SDE/SWE internship. If you have any position available, please contact me!

Skills

Languages: Python 2.7, HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript/ES6, PHP5, SQL, C++/STL, Java, QML, Sass, bash scripting
Frameworks: Django, Express, Vue.js, Bootstrap 4, React, Redux, Material-UI, Twisted, Android, Qt 5, TensorFlow
Tools: Node.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, jQuery, Axios, Celery, RabbitMQ, Redis, Pug, Webpack, Highcharts, Git, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, Eigen, Asio, WebSocket++, LIBSVM, Volley

Work Experiences

Node.js-powered Signal Visualization Platform

Feb 2018 - Jul 2018
Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, B-105 Lab
Research Assistant

Developed a signal visualization platform based on Node.js, Express.js and Vue.js.

  • Implemented the web service with Vue.js, Express.js on Mongoose/MongoDB
  • Developed the Vue.js based frontend with vue-cli, vue-router, vuex for mutations and states
  • Developed Ajax requests/responses with Axios; used Highcharts for live data visualization
  • Developed Express backend server with Pug as the view engine; integrated npm, Webpack
  • Used MongoDB/Mongoose for signal data storage; used Redis for web cache, and Nginx as reverse proxy

Kaldi-based Speech Recognition with Sparse DNN

Feb 2017 - Nov 2017
Tsinghua University, Center for Speech and Language Techonologies (CSLT)
Research Assistant

Participated in developing speech recognition (ASR) system with sparse DNN, and developed a website to visualize experiment results.

  • Implemented sparsely-connected DNNs with Python 2.7 and C++ based on Kaldi in CentOS 7
  • Analyzed the importance of DNN nodes/connections with Python 2.7, NumPy, SciPy and Pandas; used C++ and Eigen to modify DNN topology and conduct node/connection pruning
  • Reduced DNN model size by 83% by utilizing optimal brain damage to conduct DNN pruning
  • Developed a website with Apache, Bootstrap 4, jQuery, PHP 5 and Microsoft SQL Server to show the results

Qt-based driver distraction detection system

Oct 2016 - Feb 2017
BUPT, Pattern Recognition and Intelligent System Lab
Research Assistant

Developed a system to detect drivers’ distraction and visualize it based on Qt5.

  • Designed and developed QML GUI and C++/STL backend application
  • Developed multi-thread backend with QThread, and implemented data transfer with QTcpSocket
  • Implemented SVM for EEG signal classification with LIBSVM

Projects

Django-based Graduate School Application Community

Feb 2018 – Jun 2018

An experience sharing community for students in BUPT, developed with Django and React.

  • Implemented the web service with Python 2.7, Django and deployed on AWS
  • Developed ReactJS frontend with Redux, redux-thunk, redux-form and Material-UI
  • Developed MVC backend with Django on MySQL; used Celery and RabbitMQ for backend jobs
  • Used django-cachalot for ORM query cache and Redis as the web content cache
  • Improved user editing experience with CKEditor; utilized Django Haystack to optimize the search functionality; used Django ImageKit to process uploaded pictures

Machine Learning Based Activity Recognition System

Nov 2017 – Jan 2018

An experience sharing community for students in BUPT, developed with Django and React.

  • Develop an Android App with Java and Android Studio to collect Wi-Fisignal data using WifiManager Module; used SQLite as local storage, and sent data to the remote server with Volley
  • Implemented k-NN, SVM, and CNN with Python 2.7, scikit-learn and TensorFlow for signal classification; utilized Twisted to send recognition result to client
  • Used C++, Asio and WebSocket++ to receive data from the server, and visualized the human activity with Qt Widgets

Publications

Human and Machine Speaker Recognition Based on Short Trivial Events
M. Zhang, X. Kang, Y. Wang, et al.
IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (2018)
